metadata.title: CVE-2024-35883 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:spi: mchp-pci1xxx: Fix a possible null pointer dereference inpci1xxx_spi_probeIn function pci1xxxx_spi_probe, there is a potential null pointer thatmay be caused by a failed memory allocation by the function devm_kzalloc.Hence, a null pointer check needs to be added to prevent null pointerdereferencing later in the code.To fix this issue, spi_bus->spi_int[iter] should be checked. The memoryallocated by devm_kzalloc will be automatically released, so just directlyreturn -ENOMEM without worrying about memory leaks.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
